text: Murray Stanley Hoffman (April 15, 1924 - March 23, 2018) was an American cardiologist, educator and diplomat of the American Board of Internal Medicine and the American Board of Cardiovascular Disease, a Fellow of the American College of Cardiology. He was a member of the Council on Clinical Cardiology (CLCD) of the American Heart Association. He was born in Denver, Colorado. He retired in 2002. Hoffman died at a hospital in Denver on March 23, 2018 at the age of 93. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2018 deaths Category:American physicians Category:Educators from Denver Category:American diplomats Category:Scientists from Denver Category:Politicians from Denver
title: Murray S. Hoffman
